intro: Cicerbita abietina, commonly known as the alpine cicerbita, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Cicerbita abietina is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold climates.
